The Grid System

Responsive comes, not with one but with 4 tiers of 12 column fluid grids in two variants that allow for granular control over layout across all devices. The system has been written from an entirely mobile first perspective with each level overwriting the previous one as the viewport width scales up.

By standard all grids are wrapped in a div with the class .container which constrains the grid to 95% of the viewport width up to a maximum of 1140px.

Adding class .fixed to the container and using .col-xs-{number} on the columns will force the grid into a non-responsive layout.

Media Queries

The media queries specifying breakpoints are follows:

Level Selector Width
Extra small (initial) .col-xs-{number} Up to 48em (768px at 16px/1em)
Small .col-s-{number} 48em to 62em (768px to 992px at 16px/1em)
Medium .col-m-{number} 62em to 75em (992px to 1200px at 16px/1em)
Large .col-l-{number} 75em and over (1200px at 16px/1em)

Fixed

In this example the columns will persist their width from the base view all the way up. This is performed using the .col-xs-{number} tier system.

Nesting

Nesting, of course, is supported. Just add a new .row class to a div to designate a new level.

In this example the grid from each tier is being overwritten as the viewport scales up.

    <div class="col-xs-6 col-s-4">
        6

    <div class="col-xs-6 col-s-4 push-xs-right">
        6

    <div class="col-s-4">
        6
    </div>
</div>

Offsetting Columns

Columns can be offset in each direction by each column width or to the extreme right or left of their container.

Use classes .push-[size]-[number] to push by column width. .push-[size]-[direction] to move to the extremes.

4
4
4
<div class="row">
    <div class="col-xs-4">4</div>
    <div class="col-xs-4 push-xs-4">4</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
    <div class="col-xs-4 push-xs-4">4</div>
</div>

Ordering Columns

The order of columns can be flipped by combining classes .push-[size]-[number] and .pull-[size]-[number].

4
8
<div class="row">
    <div class="col-xs-4 push-xs-8">4</div>
    <div class="col-xs-8 pull-xs-4">8</div>
</div>

Resets

Each tier comes with a .col-[size]-reset class which allows you to reset the flow of the layout as the viewport scales. This allows you to perform more complicated layouts with relative ease.

<div class="row">
    <div class="col-s-3 col-m-6">
    </div>
    <div class="col-s-3 col-m-6">
    </div>
    <div class="col-s-3 col-m-6 col-reset-m col-reset-l">
    </div>
    <div class="col-s-3 col-m-6">
    </div>
</div>
